abstract: When the closing bell rang on Friday, the Dow Jones industrials had fallen 256.54 points, nearly 2 percent, to 12,800.18.
snippet: When the closing bell rang on Friday, the Dow Jones industrials had fallen 256.54 points, nearly 2 percent, to 12,800.18.
lead_paragraph: Fears that a recession is imminent  or perhaps has already begun  rocked the major stock markets this week as anxiety-addled investors staggered through the first days of 2008.

headline.main: Fears on Inflation and Jobs Give 2008 a Stumbling Start
headline.print_headline: Fears on Inflation and Jobs Give 2008 a Stumbling Start
